main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a white, blue, and red object in the sky over Columbus, Ohio on July 23, 1969.
interesting points: The object was observed for 5-6 minutes and appeared to 'crash' at the end of the sighting.
The observer sketched the path of the object relative to the horizon.
The sighting occurred during twilight conditions with no moonlight, and the object was seen against a background of scattered clouds.
The observer was unsure if the object was an aircraft or some other type of unidentified aerial phenomenon.
No other reports were received regarding this sighting in Columbus.
